ROBERTS Surname Meaning & Origin: A patronymic surname meaning son of Robert, from the Welsh given name Robert, meaning bright fame.. Derived from the Germanic elements hrod meaning fame and beraht meaning bright. Roberts is the 45th most popular surname in the United States and the 6th most common surname in Wales. The name Roberts in Ireland is usually of immigrant origin having been introduced into the country by settlers from England, Scotland and Wales. When found in Ulster Province it is sometimes found in the form MacRoberts.

Roberts Name Meaning. English: patronymic from the personal name Robert. This surname is very frequent in Wales and west central England. It is also occasionally borne by Jews, presumably as an Americanized form of a like-sounding Jewish surname.
